definition: to stand in a circle and watch
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
surname Wei
surname Guan
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
Taoist monastery/palace gate watchtower/platform

sentences.chinese: 围观者的赞美是施虐狂。

sentences.english: There were about four to five hundred people watching outside the court till the trail ended.
sentences.chinese: 至庭审结束，大约有四五百人在法院外围观。

sentences.english: He went to look after many people gathered.
sentences.chinese: 许多人围观后他也跑去看了。

sentences.english: People were standing around him and laughing, his mother was standing there in agony.
sentences.chinese: 围观的众人嘲笑他，他的母亲痛苦万分。

sentences.english: Some were so furious that they attacked his car. The crowd was dispersed three hours later.
sentences.chinese: 有些愤怒的群众便开始砸他的车，吸引了近千人围观。

sentences.english: Below, the crowd was flinging coins at the jugglers.
sentences.chinese: 他们下面，围观人群向杂耍艺人扔着硬币。

sentences.english: In the police cordon the crowd gathered outside a lot.
sentences.chinese: 在警方封锁线外聚集了不少围观群众。

sentences.english: Often I was urged on by the spectators-at least by some of them.
sentences.chinese: 在比赛时，常常有围观者为我加油打气。

sentences.english: The car attracted the interest of a horde of children.
sentences.chinese: 那辆车吸引了一大群孩子围观。

sentences.english: The on-lookers all spat on the thief.
sentences.chinese: 围观者们齐向这个小偷身上吐唾沫。
围观者的赞美是施虐狂。

sentences.english: Case also attracted a large number of public falls curious onlookers.
sentences.chinese: 坠楼案也引来大批公众好奇的围观。

sentences.english: The crowd of onlookers registered their concern and curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 围观的人群十分关心和好奇。

sentences.english: Outside the hospital, onlookers discussed Mr Chen and his situation.
sentences.chinese: 医院外，围观者讨论着陈光诚和他的处境。
侦探们撤出来并驱散了围观者。

sentences.english: The Sha recentghai Daily reported that a Chinese neologism.
sentences.chinese: 上海日报报道说，一个汉语新词“给力”，看看围观。

definition: to enjoy watching a bustling scene/to go where the crowds are
index (loanword)
to discuss spiritedly (idiom)/tongues are wagging
passer-by/stranger
one after another/in succession/one by one/continuously/diverse/in profusion/numerous and confused/pell-mell
off the stage/in the audience
to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
peanut gallery (esp. in online forums)/onlookers who are interested in the spectacle but don't have anything knowledgeable to say about it/(neologism c. 2016)
to fall over each other in their eagerness to...
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
online friend/Internet user
to screech/to shriek
to cry out in alarm or surprise
everyone
to raise eyebrows/to cast sidelong glances (expressing fear or indignation)/shocked/surprised
